name: places/ChIJBwp9hARZwokRt1uZTzhgUIE
formattedAddress: 250 E 40th St, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 250 E 40th St, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: I came here in November for a wash a blow dry. I use to come here a lot a few years ago because the way the staff would style my hair was effortless. It was my birthday and I wanted to get a Brazilian blow out. The woman although very kind, did not do a good job. She wash my hair and when telling her I wanted a blowout she quickly shut it down saying “my hair was too thick to hold a curl with a blow dryer” …. She said she would attempt to do it but it prob wouldn’t hold. Her attempt was so weak and it was almost as if she was trying to not curl the brush so it would be as if it was wasn’t working. She asked me if I ever used a relaxer to my hair which I have never done…. At this point I was just like …. Just say you don’t know how to style thick hair don’t say something like that??? She then insisted on curling my hair with a curling iron which I was against because of the fact that I could have just done it at home… The final result was giving little girls birthday party…. I was so embarrassed leaving the salon but was just focused on getting out of there and getting home asap to fix my hair myself. I still paid and tipped 25% because experience aside she was a nice women but unfortunately I will not be going back.

originalText.text: I was scared to go to a new salon after 6 years going to the same one but I am so happy with how my hair came out! Desha was amazing, I told her I was a new customer and she asked how I wanted my hair cut, she then combed through it and saw exactly what I needed. She only cut what I asked for and she gave me the exact front angles and layers I wanted. She listened and really cared to what I wanted. I will definitely be going back! If you’re nervous to try a new place I suggest this one!! Affordable prices too! And I was able to get in the same day I called.

text.text: I was scared to go to a new salon after 6 years going to the same one but I am so happy with how my hair came out! originalText.text:
Extremely rude staff. My hair is very short and a woman (a Russian lady with pink hair in the back) asked how I would like it cut. She was very frustrated and short from the beginning and overall seemed annoyed. Was trying to explain how I got a bad haircut in the past and wanted a new haircut but to keep the length. She got extremely frustrated and started basically yelling at me that she could not do anything. Was just trying to have a conversation and get her advice. Then they were going to charge me $25 for having a hair wash. Was extremely rude and unprofessional. Would never recommend to anyone.

Go to Bon Bon Salon - it is a 4 minute walk away and the service and cut there is amazing.

originalText.text: I’ve been going to Tyger for 7 years now and there’s seriously no one better. Everyone at Studio 34 is super nice and accommodating, but Tyger is definitely the best. Today he brought my hair back to life after close to 2 years of neglect and I couldn’t be happier!

originalText.text: Velibor was so great and helped me fix an over processed highlight. Now my hair is all the same color! He is very nice and knows what he is doing!
